results.title: Labyrinth
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, Eric Rattray and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: Take a journey into the Labyrinth, where nothing is as it seems. Sarah (Jennifer Connelly) spends most of her time play-acting scenes from her favourite book, The Labyrinth, or baby-sitting her younger brother, Toby. One night, frustrated with Toby’s incessant crying, she begs the goblins to take him away. When Toby actually disappears, Sarah follows him into the world of the wicked Goblin King (David Bowie), where she is given thirteen hours to conquer the Labyrinth, before her baby brother is turned into a goblin forever. An engaging fantasy film, populated by creatures created by Jim Henson’s Creature Shop, and drawing inspiration from a number of sources, including the works of Brian Froud, Maurice Sendak and M. C. Escher. Includes a special behind-the-scenes featurette detailing the making of Labyrinth.

results.title: A Short film about killing [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Krzysztof Kieslowski and Zespoly Filmowe,Film Polski
results.brief_description: This previously unreleased feature length of Kieslowski’s A Short Film About Killing is a film about killing, murder, a drifter and corporal punishment. The film seems as much about the polarities between the psychology of the murderer (representing perhaps the inner self or subconscious) and society (our conscious sense of the world) and our disconnection to it. Scenes from a drifter’s life are interspersed between those of a taxi driver who without reason is brutally murdered by the drifter. An unlawful crime is now in the hands of the law as the boy responsible faces the court and imminent sentencing, a legal death. Kieslowski does not try to explain the killer’s motivation but uses an unusual choreographed camera style to portray a disturbing disconnection between the drifter and the brutal murder of his victim. The light in the film is pulled from the edges of the frame to highlight the subject but also separate him visually from the outside world and his actions. As the court case proceeds we learn less about the motives of the killer and more of the cold morals of corporal punishment. The chilling parallels of the legal system and the unspoken psychology of the disconnected drifter are sealed with the verdict.ESC.

results.title: Cobra Verde = Slave coast [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Lucki Stipetic, Ghana Film Industry Corporation, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: Set in the early nineteenth century, Cobra Verde moves from Brazil to Dahomey in West Africa. Francisco Manoel de Silva, an historical figure at the centre of the novel, is amalgamated with that of the bandit Cobra Verde to serve Herzog’s private mythologising. But Verde is not as distinctly drawn as the obsessive characters played by Klaus Kinski in ‘Aguirre’ and ‘Fitzcarraldo’, the Herzog films with which Cobra Verde can be most directly compared. Loosely improvised and more of ‘a happening’, ‘Cobra Verde’ has some extraordinary scenes and magnificent images. The historical issues of slavery and colonialism are typically (for Herzog) subsumed in a mystico-spiritual game. Cast also includes King Ampaw, Jose Lewgoy and Salvatore Basile. In German with English subtitles. Based on the novel “The Viceroy of Ouidah” by Bruce Chatwin.

results.title: Ginger and Fred = Ginger e Fred
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Alberto Grimaldi and Produzioni Europee Associati
results.brief_description: Director Federico Fellini gently lampoons the world of television show-business in this film. Amelia and Pippo are a pair of aging celebrity impersonators who were a successful cabaret act imitating Ginger Rogers and Fred Astair. Neither one has been successful in other endeavours, and they jump at the chance of recreating their performance on a popular TV show. In the studio they find themselves surrounded by grotesque characters and treated contemptuously. Despite these disappointments however, they recall their once familiar routine and enjoy a brief moment of fame and triumph. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes Giulietta Masina and Marcello Mastroianni.

results.title: Body and soul
results.creator_credit: Robert Rossen, Bob Roberts and Enterprise Studios
results.brief_description: Robert Rossen’s noirish boxing drama chronicles the rise and ultimate moral decent of boxer Charlie Davis (John Garfield in a Oscar nominated performance). Told effectively in flashback, the film recounts Charlies days as a poor but honest son of a Jewish immigrant who reaches the heights of professional and financial success, but loses his ethics and the respect of his family and long time girlfriend (Lilli Palmer) as he succumbs to the corruption and greed surrounding the boxing ring. Rossen and screenwriter Abraham Polonsky’s parable about the dark side of the American dream is made even more pertinent by the fact that Rossen, Polonsky and star John Garfield were brought in front of the House of Un-American Activities Committee (HUAC) for their alleged communist affiliations. Rossen was subsequently blacklisted (along with Polonsky), but desperate to work ended up naming party members two years later. James Wong Howes stark black and white cinematography and the realistically staged boxing sequences were to become a major influence on Martin Scorsese 33 years later for his boxing masterpiece, “Raging Bull”. Cast also includes Hazel Brooks, William Conrad, Joseph Pevney and Lloyd Goff. (Awards: Winner of the 1948 Academy Award for Best Film Editing, Francis D. Lyon, Robert Parish)

results.title: Out of the past = Build my gallows high
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tourneur, Warren B. Duff and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: At the centre is the noir theme of a man’s destructive obsession with a femme fatale. The possibility of redemption is offered by the presence in a pastoral retreat of the safe, undemanding woman. The film’s special hallucinatory quality has its bases in Mitchum’s restrained playing and narration as the fated hero. Tourneur brings a downbeat, tragic other-worldliness to the complex flashback structure in which the past gradually overtakes the present. Photographer Nicholas Musuraca makes disconcerting use of deep shadow. Cast includes Robert Mitchum, Jane Greer, Kirk Douglas, Rhonda Fleming and Richard Webb. Based on the novel “Build my gallows high” by Geoffrey Homes.

results.title: Burnt by the sun = Utomlynonnye solntsem
results.creator_credit: Nikita Mikhalkov, Canal+, Camera One and Studio Trite
results.brief_description: Set in the Russian summer of 1936, “Burnt By the Sun” is a splendid film about the human damage wreaked by the Stalinist purges, and the betrayal of the revolutionary hopes of the Soviet people. Colonel Serguei Kotov is a military hero of the Bolshevik Revolution who is surrounded by loving family and comrades. In this ideal existence arrives a stranger, Dimitri, who represents the cold, indifferent face of Stalin’s terror. Slowly Kotov realises he is enmeshed in a senseless and violent maze from which there is no escape. Beautifully shot and executed, “Burnt By the Sun” is a study in the creeping paranoia and madness of a regime which has lost sight of its roots and lost sight of humanity. By encapsulating the drama of betrayal, corruption and totalitarianism in the personal struggle of Kotov to make sense of what it happening to himself and his family, this film offers both a powerful examination of the Stalinist era as well as acknowledging the impossibility of any one film, any one document being able to fully represent the horror of a period in which millions lost their lives, their dreams and their sanity. Academy Award winner for Best Foreign Language Film. In Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: O' Lucky man
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Michael Medwin, Sam, Memorial and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Director Lindsay Anderson delivers a film that consciously plays with the telling of a story, beginning with sepia tone and the opening line ‘Once Upon a Time’. From then on we’re launched into technicolour and taken on the surreal journey of an ambitious young man in search of success who is constantly thwarted by the British Establishment. Mick Travis (Malcolm McDowell), a trainee coffee salesman, is both optimistic and naive. With his desire to be successful he eagerly jumps at any opportunity with wilful ignorance that inevitably leads him into the path of sinister digressions that challenge his good intentions. Each vignette plays on the genres of film from horror to comedy, realism to surrealism. The actors deftly play several roles each, their characters weave in and out of the story line to occasionally reconnect in this sprawling celebration of allegory.

results.title: Hawks and sparrows = Uccellacci e uccellini [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: In Pasolini’s picaresque serio-comic fable-essay-confession on the theme of social justice, a father and son set out to emulate St. Francis of Assissi’s mission to convert the birds to Christianity. Wandering the Italian landscape, they encounter a wise talking crow, who follows them along retelling left wing parables. Cast includes Toto and Ninetto Davoli. Musical score by Ennio Morricone.

results.title: On golden pond
results.creator_credit: Mark Rydell, Bruce Gilbert and ITC Films
results.brief_description: Cranky 80-year-old retired professor Norman Thayer makes his annual pilgrimage with his wife, Ethel, to their New England summer lake-side home. Their solitude is interrupted, however, when their daughter, Chelsea, arrives with her new fiancee and his son, Billy, in tow. The three generations collide, but after persuading Norman and Ethel to mind Billy, Chelsea and fiancee leave for a romantic European holiday. What begins as a stubborn battle of wills between Norman and Billy, slowly turns into the relationship Norman never had with his own daughter. However, it is through this warm and accepting relationship with Billy that both Norman and Chelsea are finally able to display affection towards one another. Cast includes Katharine Hepburn, Henry Fonda, Jane Fonda, Doug McKeon and Dabney Coleman.

What begins as a stubborn battle of wills between Norman and Billy, slowly turns into the relationship Norman never had with his own daughter. However, it is through this warm and accepting relationship with Billy that both Norman and Chelsea are finally able to display affection towards one another. Cast includes Katharine Hepburn, Henry Fonda, Jane Fonda, Doug McKeon and Dabney Coleman.
